metadata.name: Victorian Ghost
metadata.description:
Longing back when once alive
That warm embrace of love in truest faith
Many said they care for him
Many said there was love for him
Falsehoods they were of a devilish manner
Caring more of the Victorian sweet grandeur
Not the heart that once beat within his chest
Not the soul who longed for loves embrace
Alone he had stayed til the very end
Alone he was even after the end
His afterlife as lonely as living
His eternal soul always seeking forgiving
His heart now laid within the clock
Longing true love with each tick and each tock
Would it ever come in its truest form
Would he ever finally experience that love and that care
The ghost had wondered and pondered his days longing to get to feel that way
Within his spirit he still felt a heart
Even though his body did depart
Eternally waiting and seeking his love
A love both true and virtuous in wake
Many a millennia had past since the day his spirit and body had been so awake
Now his place and his heart was so much in dismay

Nicholas Spandre
